name: Path T Melanoma Iris
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Ciliary body and Iris are both included in the ICD-O-3 site code of C694, but they are staged with different criteria by TNM.  
* The Schema Discriminator is used to select the schema appropriate for coding extension for melanoma of the iris.  

**Note 2:**  Melanomas of the uveal arise most commonly in the choroid, less frequently in the ciliary body, and least often in the iris.  Melanomas of the iris tend to be small, and those arising from or extending to the ciliary body typically are large.

**Note 3:** Assign 88 for in situ cases (behavior code /2). TNM does not include an in situ category for iris tumors.

**Note 4:** Iris melanomas originate from, and are predominantly located in, this region of the uvea. If less than one-half of the tumor volume is located within the iris, the tumor may have originated in the ciliary body and consideration should be given to classifying it accordingly. (1)
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 285
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a, T1b and T1c. Assign T1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Localized, NOS

Stated as T1 [NOS]
Not more than 3 clock hours in size

Limited to iris not more than 3 clock hours in size
WITHOUT melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma, or not stated if melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T1a
More than 3 clock hours in size

Limited to iris more than 3 clock hours in size 
WITHOUT melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma, or not stated if melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T1b

Limited to iris WITH melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T1c

Tumor confluent WITH or extending into:  
    Ciliary body, choroid or both

Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body and/or choroid 
WITHOUT melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma, or not stated if melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T2 [NOS]

Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body and/or choroid 
WITH melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T2a

Tumor confluent WITH or extending into:  
    Ciliary body, choroid or both, WITH scleral extension

Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body and/or choroid WITH scleral extension
WITHOUT melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma, or not stated if melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T3 [NOS]

Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliarybody and/or choroid WITH scleral extension 
WITH melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T3a

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Extrascleral (extraocular) extension, measurement of diameter not specified

Stated as T4 [NOS]
Less than or equal to 5 mm in diameter

Tumor with extrascleral (extraocular) extension less than or equal to 5 mm in diameter

Stated as T4a

Tumor with extrascleral (extraocular) extension greater than 5 mm in diameter

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4b
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No pathologic evaluation of primary tumor
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of the highest T
